S

saveActivityEntryToDB(String, String, String) - Method in class application.LoginModel
This method saves a record describing an action the currently logged in user has just performed and saves an entry with the action, time and username of the currently logged in account into the database the managers can look through
saveActivityEntryToDB(String, String, String) - Method in class application.ManagerScreenModel
Takes strings for the username, activity description, and timestamp, then inserts a new record with all of these into the activityLog table for managers to track.
saveActivityEntryToDB(String, String, String) - Method in class application.StaffScreenModel
Takes three strings, a username, activity description, and a timestamps, and then registers a new record into the activityLog
saveActivityLog(String) - Method in class application.LoginController
This takes just a simple string describing an event or action the currently logged in user performs , it generates a time string and records the username of the currently logged in user, and passes these to the LoginModel object method to save the activity log to the database.
saveActivityLog(String) - Method in class application.ManagerScreenController
Takes a string description of a user activity or event, generates a date string, and keeps a note of the currently logged in user, and passes them all to a manager model method to save a record to the activityLog
saveActivityLog(String) - Method in class application.StaffScreenController
This method takes a simple string describing a user activity or action and then passes it, alongwith a timestamp and the username of the logged in user, to a StaffModel method which then records an entry the manager can look at later.
saveCurrentOrder() - Method in class application.StaffScreenController
Takes all the components of the currently selected table and its working order and then writes them to the database.
saveCurrentOrderToDatabase(int, ObservableList<Food>, double, String, String, String, Date) - Method in class application.StaffScreenModel
Checks if the input tableNo already has a working order in the database, if it does it updates all fields apart from the time of order, (and the tableNo as that wouldn't make sense).
saveImportedCsvOrderToSystem() - Method in class application.ManagerScreenController
This takes an observable list of orders displayed in the tableview and saves and appends them to the stored orders.
saveImportToDB(ObservableList<Order>) - Method in class application.ManagerScreenModel
Takes a list of order objects (in this context imported from a csv file) and then saves each of them into the stored records table in the database
saveImportToDbBtn - Variable in class application.ManagerScreenController
 
saveNewDishToMenu() - Method in class application.ManagerScreenController
Takes the user inputted name and price for a new food item, and then uses a ManagerModel method to insert the new item into the menu table of the database.
saveOrderBtn - Variable in class application.StaffScreenController
 
searchAllOrdersBtn - Variable in class application.StaffScreenController
 
searchByComments(String, String) - Method in class application.StaffScreenModel
Takes a string input which is aimed at finding orders with specified comments, and takes a string input group which determines which table in the database to search ('stored orders' or just 'orders' for the working orders).
searchByDate(String, String) - Method in class application.StaffScreenModel
Takes a date formatted string string which is aimed at finding orders which were registered on a specified date, and takes a string input group which determines which table in the database to search ('stored orders' or just 'orders' for the working orders).
searchByFoodItem(String, String) - Method in class application.StaffScreenModel
Takes a string input which is aimed at finding orders with specified food items, and takes a string input group which determines which table in the database to search ('stored orders' or just 'orders' for the working orders).
searchByIfComplete(String, String) - Method in class application.StaffScreenModel
Takes a string input ('true', or 'false') which is aimed at finding orders which have been marked as complete or not complete, and takes a string input group which determines which table in the database to search ('stored orders' or just 'orders' for the working orders).
searchByPrice() - Method in class application.StaffScreenController
This method records user inputted price values, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all orders from that table corresponding to the entered range.
searchByPrice(String, double, double) - Method in class application.StaffScreenModel
Takes a string input which is aimed at finding orders whih bills fall within a specified price range, and takes a string input group which determines which table in the database to search ('stored orders' or just 'orders' for the working orders).
searchBySpecialRequest(String, String) - Method in class application.StaffScreenModel
Takes a string input which is aimed at finding orders with specified special requests, and takes a string input group which determines which table in the database to search ('stored orders' or just 'orders' for the working orders).
searchByTableNo(String, int) - Method in class application.StaffScreenModel
Takes a table number integer input, and takes a string input group which determines which table in the database to search ('stored orders' or just 'orders' for the working orders).
searchByTime(String, String, String, String, String) - Method in class application.StaffScreenModel
Takes a time formatted string string which is aimed at finding orders which were registered within specified time intervals, and takes a string input group which determines which table in the database to search ('stored orders' or just 'orders' for the working orders).
searchByWhetherOrderComplete() - Method in class application.StaffScreenController
This method records a user choice of whether to look for completed orders or incomplete orders, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all corresponding orders from that table.
searchCommentsBtn - Variable in class application.StaffScreenController
 
searchCommentsTxt - Variable in class application.StaffScreenController
 
searchFoodBtn - Variable in class application.StaffScreenController
 
searchFoodItemTxt - Variable in class application.StaffScreenController
 
searchForComment() - Method in class application.StaffScreenController
This method records a user inputted string to try and match with thecomment field of an order, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all orders from that table corresponding to the entered string.
searchForDate() - Method in class application.StaffScreenController
This method records a user choice from a JavaFX DatePicker, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all orders from that table from that chosen date.
searchForFoodItem() - Method in class application.StaffScreenController
This method records a user inputted string to try and match with the name of a food item, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all corresponding orders from that table.
searchForSpecialRequest() - Method in class application.StaffScreenController
This method records a user inputted string to try and match with the special requests field of an order, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all orders from that table.
searchForTableNum() - Method in class application.StaffScreenController
This method records the user inputted table number, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all orders from that table.
searchForTimeInterval() - Method in class application.StaffScreenController
This method records a user time range entered in TextFields, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all orders from that table within the fiven time.

setMenuItemName(String) - Method in class application.Food
 
setPrice(Double) - Method in class application.Food
 
signOut(ActionEvent) - Method in class application.ManagerScreenController
Upon clicking the sign out button the manager screen is hidden, the login screen opened, and the current user logged out, so his activity no longer logged.
signOut(ActionEvent) - Method in class application.StaffScreenController
Upon clicking the sign out button the user will be taken back to the login screen and the staff screen will be hidden, activity logging will be stopped at this point until someone logs in again.
sixClickCount - Variable in class application.StaffScreenController
 
specialReqsCol - Variable in class application.StaffScreenController
 
specialRequests - Variable in class application.Order
 
specialRequestsString - Variable in class application.StaffScreenController
 
specialRequestsTxt - Variable in class application.StaffScreenController
 
SqliteConnection - Class in application
This class establishes a connection with a local SQLite database file called 'RestaurantDB.sqlite' It contains a method Connector() which either makes use of this file in the same directory, or if the file is not found it will create an empty database of the same name This class makes use of a 3rd party library, the SQLite JDBC Driver available from https://bitbucket.org/xerial/sqlite-jdbc/downloads
SqliteConnection() - Constructor for class application.SqliteConnection
 
Staff - Class in application
The staff class instantiates Staff objects that can be displayed in Tableviews after retriving the relevent data from a database
Staff(int, String, String, String) - Constructor for class application.Staff
The class constructor takes int andString type inputs and outputs a Staff object with javafx properties that can be displayed in a tableview.
staffID - Variable in class application.Staff
 
staffIdCol - Variable in class application.ManagerScreenController
 
staffModel - Variable in class application.StaffScreenController
 
StaffScreenController - Class in application
This class handles the logic behind the StaffScreen GUI, besides direct database interactions
StaffScreenController() - Constructor for class application.StaffScreenController
 
StaffScreenModel - Class in application
This class handles the database interactions needed for the StaffScreenController
StaffScreenModel() - Constructor for class application.StaffScreenModel
The class constructor checks whether the connection to the database is active, if not the program is closed.
staffTableView - Variable in class application.ManagerScreenController
 
staffTableViewObsList - Variable in class application.ManagerScreenController
 
staffUsernameListView - Variable in class application.ManagerScreenController
 
start(Stage) - Method in class application.Main
 
storeTemporaryCredentials(String, String) - Method in class application.ManagerScreenController
Holds onto the account credentials of the current user when switching between staff and manager screens or vice versa
storeTemporaryCredentials(String, String) - Method in class application.StaffScreenController
This method takes user credentials and holds them in ocal variables when switching between manager and staff screens therefore allowing activity logging even when screens are switched.
switchToManageBtn - Variable in class application.StaffScreenController
 
switchToManagerScreen(ActionEvent) - Method in class application.StaffScreenController
upon clicking the manage button the user, if their credentials permit, will be taken to the manager screen and the staff screen will be hidden.
switchToStaffBtn - Variable in class application.ManagerScreenController
 
switchToStaffScreen(ActionEvent) - Method in class application.ManagerScreenController
Upon clicking the staff screen button an event is passed to this method which then hides the manager sreen and displays the staff screen so the manager can also do some real work.
